title: One injured in shooting at California high school
text:
A teenage gunman and his alleged accomplice have been arrested after a shooting at a northern California high school on Tuesday.

The unidentified gunman produced a handgun from a backpack and opened fire outside Ridgeway High School in Santa Rosa, around 50 miles north of San Francisco, at around 9.10am.

He shot one victim - another male - in the stomach and then fled.

Later, he and another person were seen being put in handcuffs and taken away from the scene.

The victim had by that point been driven to the hospital by a friend. He is undergoing surgery.

Police say it was a targeted shooting and that there is no threat to the community.

Two people, believed to be the gunman and his accomplice, were arrested on the school property

One student was put in handcuffs and led away from the scene but police have not yet confirmed that they are the shooter. As of their most recent update, the gunman is at large

Several students were handcuffed as they were removed from this campus building. They were made to sit on bleachers outside the school

Ridgeway High School in Santa Rosa, a city 50 miles north of San Francisco, on Tuesday after a shooter opened fire on campus

The incident however sparked terror at the time.

Ridgeway shares a campus with Ridgeway College and it is also next to St. Luke Lutheran Church and school. All three schools were put in lock down.

Aerial footage showed cops slowly clearing classrooms.

Once outside, the students were lined up on bleachers.

Teachers at the other schools on the campus phoned local outlet Kron 4 to describe hiding in place in their classrooms.

Once said he had turned all the lights off and drawn the blinds of his classroom.

Armed SWAT team members were pictured at the scene. Police say it was a targeted shooting
description: The unidentified gunman produced a handgun from a backpack and opened fire outside Ridgeway High School in Santa Rosa, around 50 miles north of San Francisco, at around 9.10am.
